name: demagoguery
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of winning support by exciting the emotions of ordinary people rather than by having good or morally right ideas: They accused opponents of demagoguery. A different approach is needed, one divorced from cheap political demagoguery. See
demagogue
More examplesFewer examplesThe racist demagoguery against foreign nationals living in the country accounted for the party's victories.He has alienated many people with his increasing demagoguery and use of violence against the opposition. She escaped a totalitarian regime and the oppressive demagoguery of its political leaders.
